summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons memorandum from the Office of Quality Management, Health Services Division, summarizing a multi-level mortality chart review. It indicates that Jeffrey Epstein's death at MCC New York on August 10, 2019, was identified as having quality of care or risk management issues, requiring a corrective action response. The attached consultant's comments detail the circumstances of his suicide and recommend procedural improvements regarding AED maintenance and psychological review participation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The 66-year-old inmate who died by suicide via hanging at MCC New York on August 10, 2019. The document details his medical history and the timeline of events leading to his death.

persons.name: Fluker Roy
persons.context: A 64-year-old male inmate who died of congestive heart failure at FMC Devens on June 18, 2019. His death was reviewed and had no findings.

persons.name: Charles Phillips
persons.context: A 68-year-old male inmate who died of heart failure at an unspecified facility on May 13, 2019. His death was reviewed and had no findings.

persons.name: Lee Garling
persons.context: A 78-year-old male inmate who died of pneumonia at Elkton FCI on May 6, 2019. His death was reviewed and had no findings.

persons.name: Anthony Hornbaker
persons.context: A 60-year-old male inmate who died of atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease at Loretto FCI on June 28, 2019. His death was reviewed and had no findings.

events.title: Epstein placed on suicide watch
events.description: At 2:00 am, Jeffrey Epstein was placed on suicide watch for 31 hours and 5 minutes due to an abrasion found on the lower anterior surface of his neck.

events.title: Epstein removed from suicide watch
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was taken off suicide watch and placed on psychological observation.

events.title: Epstein placed in Special Housing Unit
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was removed from psychological observation and placed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) where he was housed with a cell mate.

events.title: Epstein denies suicidal ideation
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was seen by Psychology Services and denied any suicidal ideation, intention, or plan.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: At 6:33 a.m., SHU staff found Jeffrey Epstein unresponsive in his cell. CPR was initiated, medical staff and EMS responded, but he was pronounced dead at 7:36 a.m. by an ER physician. The cause was determined to be suicide by hanging.

events.title: Mortality review conducted
events.description: An independent consultant, an M.D., conducted a review of inmate mortality cases, including Jeffrey Epstein's, as part of the Bureau of Prisons' quality improvement process.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide via hanging at MCC New York on August 10, 2019, and was pronounced dead at 7:36 a.m.
An official Bureau of Prisons mortality review identified quality of care or risk management issues related to Epstein's death at MCC New York, requiring a corrective action plan.
Epstein had been placed on suicide watch on July 23, 2019, due to a neck abrasion, but was removed the next day and later placed in the Special Housing Unit with a cellmate.
Just two days before his death, on August 8, 2019, Epstein denied any suicidal ideation, intention, or plan to Psychology Services.

The consultant's review highlighted issues with AED (Automated External Defibrillator) maintenance protocols and recommended adding Health Services staff to psychological suicide reconstruction reviews.
